div.bibl: Przebudzenie, Vol. II, No. 11, March 18, 1928. [MAKE CRIME PAY]

body.p: In a recent address to a jury, Federal Justice Walter C. Lindley pointed out that our country is spending immense sums of money in its fight with the criminal world.
As for us, we advocate the confinement of all criminals to an island, where they would be employed in government factories.
This way the criminals would have to make up for the damages they caused to the country by their crimes.
